conclusion: The loop is an equilateral triangle with side length \( a \). The loop moves to the right with a constant speed \( v \). The side \( CD \) is always perpendicular to the boundary \( MN \).
The loop enters the magnetic field, and the effective length of the loop in the magnetic field is the length of the side \( CD \) that is within the magnetic field.

premise: When point \( D \) reaches the boundary \( MN \), the length of \( CD \) in the magnetic field is \( a \).
conclusion: The induced EMF \( \mathcal{E} \) in a conductor moving through a magnetic field is given by \( \mathcal{E} = B \cdot l \cdot v \).

premise: The maximum EMF occurs when the entire side \( CD \) is within the magnetic field.
conclusion: At this point, the effective length \( l \) is equal to the side length \( a \).

premise: The maximum EMF is given by \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = B \cdot a \cdot v \).
conclusion: The maximum value of the induced electromotive force during the process is \( B \cdot a \cdot v \).
